Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue ""Unable to load the service index for source https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json" in unbuntu" (#8351) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
I'm using **ubuntu 18.04 LTS** and going to build my application using dotnet build
but it pops an error that tells _Unable to load the service index for source https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json._
I tried to search the same issue and I found this [thread](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7705). but all comments in this thread show how to fix in windows, not in ubuntu.
could some one tell me the solution in my case? 
thanks

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Add fuget.org links to packages" (#8364) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Addresses: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7850

Packages will now have an additional link per specs outlined here: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/pull/7832, linking to the packages fuget.org view.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14225979/102949684-8e0fe180-4514-11eb-89b3-8f69bbfd4cf2.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Show vulnerability alerts on manage packages page" (#8363) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Note: these PRs must be merged before this one: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/pull/8358, https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/pull/8362

Addresses remainder of https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/8361

This change decorates all packages, of which any version is vulnerable, in the manage packages view with a bang and tooltip indicating to go to the details page. This applies to listed and unlisted groups of packages.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14225979/102943956-2ef6a080-4505-11eb-8200-76e3457cdc1b.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Expand view models for vulnerabilities in manage packages page" (#8362) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: Addresses view model portion of https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/8361 (I split the PR as best I could because it's large-ish). Full description of change to customer experience in PR (view changes) on this issue.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Gallery authors should see a message on the Manage Packages page if the package is vulnerable" (#8361) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: Spec: https://github.com/NuGet/Home/blob/dev/designs/PackageVulnerability/NuGet.orgVulnerabilitiesPhase1.md

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Ownership request email for an org should be sent to org account email ID as well" (#8360) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Today it seems the ownership request emails are only sent to the `Administrators` of the org account. This causes a lot of confusion as folks keep looking for an email on the org account's email ID. 

#### How to fix this?
We should be sending an email to the org account email ID stating an ownership request was sent to the Admins.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "update term used for .NET tools" (#8359) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
As per the [linked document](https://aka.ms/global-tools), these are now referred to as ".NET Tools" ‚Äî

> How to manage .NET tools
> 
> A .NET tool is a special NuGet package that contains a console application.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Missing tests for the case where packages are referenced with PrivateAssets="All" attribute" (#10397) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet version: dev

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

There are no `RemoteDependencyWalker` tests for the case where packages are referenced with PrivateAssets="All" attribute, e.g.:
```
    -> Lib1 -> PackageA [1.0.0] (PrivateAssets=All)
App
    -> Lib2 -> PackageA [2.0.0] (PrivateAssets=All)
```

Because of that these lines don't have any test coverage: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/b5b44526dea0379ebd6c8e51e8a041c06d5845ca/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.DependencyResolver.Core/Remote/RemoteDependencyWalker.cs#L166-L169

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Floating versions not working for pre-release packages with semantic versioning suffix like "-alpha"" (#10408) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used: NuGet.exe

NuGet version: 5.8.0.6930

VS version: Visual Studio Professional 2019 Version 16.8.3

OS version: Windows 10 Pro for Workstations, 64 bits, Version 2004, OS build 19041.685

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Create and deploy a library as NuGet package. Push it as pre-release: LibA.2.1.1-alpha, for example

2. Create another library, called LibB, that references the first NuGet package. Specify its dependency in its .nuspec using floating versions and push it as pre-release:

```
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<package xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/packaging/2010/07/nuspec.xsd">
    <metadata>
        <dependencies>
            <group>
                <dependency id="LibA" version="2.1.1-*" />
            </group>
        </dependencies>
    </metadata>
</package>
```

3. Create yet another driver program that references LibB pre-released NuGet package.
4. When you try to install/update LibB NuGet package in the driver program, errors occur:
   - Package restore failed. Rolling back package changes for 'NAME_OF_DRIVER_PROGRAM'.
   - NU1603: LibB depends on LibA (>= 1.2.1-0) but LibA 1.2.1.0 was not found. An approximate best match of LibA 1.2.1-alpha was resolved.

Note, on the Common Scenarios section in the documentation (https://github.com/NuGet/Home/wiki/Support-pre-release-packages-with-floating-versions), it shows that floating versions like `1.2.0-*` will match pre-released versions like `1.2.0-rc.2`.

How come that doesn't work in my case?

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "PM UI throws InvalidCastException for SolutionView to ProjectView" (#10416) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Sometimes while debugging NuGet in experimental instance, you can see this exception.

Started in timeframe of August 2020. Many team members mentioned it in September-November timeframe.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Reason: Generated API Key is Truncated" (#10415) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe):

NuGet version (5.8.0.6930):

dotnet.exe --version (if appropriate):

VS version (i16.8.3):

OS version (10.0.19042.685)):

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version: 4.9.4.5839

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Generate a NEW API key.

2. Copy the generated key into nuget.config. Note that the new key string is only 46 characters long. Until yesterday, every API key that I have received had a length of 352 characters. of which the last two were "==". The fact that the 46-character keys that I generated yesterday were not so terminated made me immediately suspicious, because I've generated and used many cryptographic keys, most of which were so terminated.
3. Attempt to push package.

...

## Other suggested things
The NuGet Push is accomplished by the following Task, which is unchanged for many months and package updates across 13 packages.

<!-- 2019/07/05 16:43:12 - DAG Switch on the push target. -->
  <!-- Publish the project. -->
  <Target Name="Publish"
  	      AfterTargets="Package"
  	      Condition=" '$(Configuration)' == 'Release'">
    <NuGetPackageNameFixup RawNugetPackageVersion="%(OutputAssemblyInfo.Version)">
      <Output PropertyName="NuGetPackageVersion"
      	      TaskParameter="ActualNugetPackageVersion" />
    </NuGetPackageNameFixup>

    <Exec WorkingDirectory="$(PackageDir)"
    	  Command="NuGet.exe push $(AssemblyName).$(NuGetPackageVersion).nupkg -Source nuget.org" />
  </Target>


### Verbose Logs
The log from the last attempt to push follows.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Project Dependencies of ProjectReferences marked as PrivateAssets should not be included in the lock file up to date check" (#8565) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
[8493.zip](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/files/3593090/8493.zip)

Extract the above project, run dotnet restore --locked-mode

Motivation from https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/8493. 

Issue being hit by @bddckr 

fyi @tebeco Not your specific issue, but one that the discussion produced. 

I want to keep this issue focused to the problem at hand. 

Specifically refer to https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/8493#issuecomment-526537492. 

Note that this has never worked correctly, so not a regression (in 4.9, it simply didn't validate it)

The fix is: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/638f34578d2221abc1259286ce2d4c132600cea7/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.ProjectModel/ProjectLockFile/PackagesLockFileUtilities.cs#L168

We should strip out the PrivateAssets=All project references from `p2pSpecProjectRestoreMetadataFrameworkInfo.ProjectReferences`. 

fyi @rrelyea

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Restore fails with NU1004 after running nuget restore with -ForceEvaluate" (#10374) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

This has some of the same symptoms as https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/9332 but may not be the same issue; it happened under different circumstances and this time I was able to assemble a small solution that can reproduce the problem.

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe): NuGet.exe

NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx):  5.8.0.6930

dotnet.exe --version (if appropriate): n/a

VS version (if appropriate): 16.8.3

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)): Windows 10

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version: 5.3?

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Unzip attached Repro.zip archive

2. Restore the repro solution with nuget.exe and -ForceEvaluate => should succeed
```
nuget restore -ForceEvaluate Repro.sln
```

3. Restore the repro solution with nuget.exe and -LockedMode => should FAIL!
```
nuget restore -LockedMode Repro.sln
```

### Verbose Logs
```
NU1004: The packages lock file is inconsistent with the project dependencies so restore can't be run in locked mode. Disable the RestoreLockedMode MSBuild property or pass an explicit --force-evaluate option to run restore to update the lock file.
NU1004: The packages lock file is inconsistent with the project dependencies so restore can't be run in locked mode. Disable the RestoreLockedMode MSBuild property or pass an explicit --force-evaluate option to run restore to update the lock file.

```

### Sample Solution
[Repro.zip](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/files/5680970/Repro.zip)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue ""Unable to load the service index for source https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json" in unbuntu" (#10414) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
@hieunm22 commented on [Sun Dec 13 2020](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/8351)

I'm using **ubuntu 18.04 LTS** and going to build my application using dotnet build
but it pops an error that tells _Unable to load the service index for source https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json._
I tried to search the same issue and I found this [thread](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7705). but all comments in this thread show how to fix in windows, not in ubuntu.
could some one tell me the solution in my case? 
thanks

---

@agr commented on [Thu Dec 17 2020](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/8351#issuecomment-747690955)

Apologies for the delayed response.

Could you please share a full build log with detailed verbosity (`dotnet build --verbosity detailed`)? Feel free to send it to support@nuget.org if you don't want to put it here.

The thread you mention is specifically about addressing an SSL/TLS issues, do you see error messages that mention it?
Are you able to open `www.nuget.org` in a browser on that computer? Does `curl https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json` succeed?

---

@hieunm22 commented on [Thu Dec 17 2020](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/8351#issuecomment-747840418)

Thanks for your response althought late
Here's the full log with the command you provided above
https://controlc.com/1e820605

The URL `www.nuget.org` can be accessed normally in browser, and so can the `curl https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json`

Some additional informations in my case:
- I created a new project with type = "mvc", type = "console" and the command `dotnet build` runs successfully but some types such as "react", "classlib" doesn't
- The `dotnet build` command in my windows 10 machine runs properly

---

@agr commented on [Mon Dec 21 2020](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/8351#issuecomment-749158985)

Which SDK version are you using? Tried updating to the latest one?
I tried setting up an Ubuntu 18.04 VM to try to reproduce the issue and with the latest SDK it worked fine.

I am looking at the log, and I see that it fails but with a different error:

> /usr/share/dotnet/sdk/3.1.404/NuGet.targets(128,5): error : Unable to get repository signature information for source https://api.nuget.org/v3-index/repository-signatures/5.0.0/index.json.
/usr/share/dotnet/sdk/3.1.404/NuGet.targets(128,5): error :   The SSL connection could not be established, see inner exception.
/usr/share/dotnet/sdk/3.1.404/NuGet.targets(128,5): error :   The remote certificate is invalid according to the validation procedure.

You mentioned that it complained about "Unable to load the service index for source https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json." before. Do you get consistent error messages?

Please, send us the output of `echo | openssl s_client -servername api.nuget.org -connect api.nuget.org:443 2>/dev/null`
The issue might be related to the version of OpenSSL on your system, please try updating to the latest one.

---

@hieunm22 commented on [Tue Dec 22 2020](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/8351#issuecomment-749932388)

all dotnet components are up to date to version 3.1 LTS
what's your latest version? latest version is currently 5.0
 
this is the outout for the command above

`https://controlc.com/299441b0`

about the openssl, i updated it to latest version. is it the latest one: 1.1.1g  21 Apr 2020



---

@agr commented on [Wed Dec 23 2020](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/8351#issuecomment-750456425)

Yes, I was using 5.0. I also installed 3.1 it works fine, too.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "UninstallPackageFromUI is flaky" (#10412) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
NuGetUITestCase.UninstallPackageFromUI is extremely flaky. 

It fails because of loading the PM UI control. Instictively this sounds like something that *should not* be specific to this test, but it's always the same one, despite the fact that many tests do the same thing.

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "November dry run for custom V2 OData query deprecation" (#48) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
We announced the deprecation of custom V2 OData queries (https://github.com/NuGet/Announcements/issues/37) last year and we will begin blocking endpoints used by 3rd party clients in **February 2021**. 

We will conduct **a dry run of the OData deprecation** to ensure that there are no surprises for users, which is scheduled to ensure overlap with normal working hours across the globe. The goal is to help you identify systems that may be affected and will give you an opportunity to take action before we permanently remove support for select v2 endpoints.
¬†
There will be two stages in the brown-out to accommodate a variety of usage scenarios. During these times, we will be heavily monitoring social media and other communication channels to address questions and concerns. 
	¬∑ **Nov. 11, 2020** ‚Äì 3 time slots in a 24 hour period, for 4 hours each
	¬∑ **Nov. 17 & 18, 2020**¬† ‚Äì¬†48 hours

Please let us know about your questions or concerns on [this discussion post](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7423).
¬†
Refer to the table below to identify the test slot time in your time zone.
	¬∑ UTC-9 to UTC-2 ‚Äì¬†[Green test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Green+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3923&ah=4)
	¬∑ UTC-1 to UTC+6 ‚Äì¬†[Yellow test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Yellow+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3915&ah=4)
	¬∑ UTC+7 to UTC-10 ‚Äì¬†[Blue test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Blue+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3909&ah=4)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "November dry run for custom V2 OData query deprecation" (#48) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
We announced the deprecation of custom V2 OData queries (https://github.com/NuGet/Announcements/issues/37) last year and we will begin blocking endpoints used by 3rd party clients in **February 2021**. 

We will conduct **a dry run of the OData deprecation** to ensure that there are no surprises for users, which is scheduled to ensure overlap with normal working hours across the globe. The goal is to help you identify systems that may be affected and will give you an opportunity to take action before we permanently remove support for select v2 endpoints.
¬†
There will be two stages in the brown-out to accommodate a variety of usage scenarios. During these times, we will be heavily monitoring social media and other communication channels to address questions and concerns. 
	¬∑ **Nov. 11, 2020** ‚Äì 3 time slots in a 24 hour period, for 4 hours each
	¬∑ **Nov. 17 & 18, 2020**¬† ‚Äì¬†48 hours

Please let us know about your questions or concerns on [this discussion post](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7423).
¬†
Refer to the table below to identify the test slot time in your time zone.
	¬∑ UTC-9 to UTC-2 ‚Äì¬†[Green test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Green+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3923&ah=4)
	¬∑ UTC-1 to UTC+6 ‚Äì¬†[Yellow test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Yellow+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3915&ah=4)
	¬∑ UTC+7 to UTC-10 ‚Äì¬†[Blue test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Blue+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3909&ah=4)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "November dry run for custom V2 OData query deprecation" (#48) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
We announced the deprecation of custom V2 OData queries (https://github.com/NuGet/Announcements/issues/37) last year and we will begin blocking endpoints used by 3rd party clients in **February 2021**. 

We will conduct **a dry run of the OData deprecation** to ensure that there are no surprises for users, which is scheduled to ensure overlap with normal working hours across the globe. The goal is to help you identify systems that may be affected and will give you an opportunity to take action before we permanently remove support for select v2 endpoints.
¬†
There will be two stages in the brown-out to accommodate a variety of usage scenarios. During these times, we will be heavily monitoring social media and other communication channels to address questions and concerns. 
	¬∑ **Nov. 11, 2020** ‚Äì 3 time slots in a 24 hour period, for 4 hours each
	¬∑ **Nov. 17 & 18, 2020**¬† ‚Äì¬†48 hours

Please let us know about your questions or concerns on [this discussion post](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7423).
¬†
Refer to the table below to identify the test slot time in your time zone.
	¬∑ UTC-9 to UTC-2 ‚Äì¬†[Green test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Green+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3923&ah=4)
	¬∑ UTC-1 to UTC+6 ‚Äì¬†[Yellow test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Yellow+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3915&ah=4)
	¬∑ UTC+7 to UTC-10 ‚Äì¬†[Blue test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Blue+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3909&ah=4)
